intro: Gilia aggregata subsp. euaggregata, commonly known as the clustered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has erect, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
